00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the Mips interrupts.
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 153454 $<hr>
00046  */
00047 #ifndef __CVMX_INTERRUPT_H__
00048 #define __CVMX_INTERRUPT_H__
00049 
00050 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00051 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00052 extern "C" {
00053 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 /**
00057  * Enumeration of Interrupt numbers
00058  */
00059 typedef enum {
00060     /* 0 - 7 represent the 8 MIPS standard interrupt sources */
00061     CVMX_IRQ_SW0 = 0,
00062     CVMX_IRQ_SW1,
00063     CVMX_IRQ_MIPS2,
00064     CVMX_IRQ_MIPS3,
00065     CVMX_IRQ_MIPS4,
00066     CVMX_IRQ_MIPS5,
00067     CVMX_IRQ_MIPS6,
00068     CVMX_IRQ_MIPS7,
00069     /* 64 WORKQ interrupts. */
00070     CVMX_IRQ_WORKQ0,
00071     /* 16 GPIO interrupts. */
00072     CVMX_IRQ_GPIO0 = CVMX_IRQ_WORKQ0 + 64,
00073     /* 4  MBOX interrupts. */
00074     CVMX_IRQ_MBOX0 = CVMX_IRQ_GPIO0 + 16,
00075     /* 3  UART interrupts. */
00076     CVMX_IRQ_UART0 = CVMX_IRQ_MBOX0 + 4,
00077     CVMX_IRQ_PCI_INT0 = CVMX_IRQ_UART0 + 3,
00078     CVMX_IRQ_PCI_INT1,
00079     CVMX_IRQ_PCI_INT2,
00080     CVMX_IRQ_PCI_INT3,
00081     CVMX_IRQ_PCI_MSI0,
00082     CVMX_IRQ_PCI_MSI1,
00083     CVMX_IRQ_PCI_MSI2,
00084     CVMX_IRQ_PCI_MSI3,
00085     /* 2 TWSI interrupts */
00086     CVMX_IRQ_TWSI0,
00087     CVMX_IRQ_RML = CVMX_IRQ_TWSI0 + 2,
00088     /* 4 TRACE interrupts added in CN68XX */
00089     CVMX_IRQ_TRACE0,
00090     /* 5 GMX_DRP interrupts added in CN68XX */
00091     CVMX_IRQ_GMX_DRP0 = CVMX_IRQ_TRACE0 + 4,
00092     CVMX_IRQ_GMX_DRP1,  /* Doesn't apply on CN52XX or CN63XX */
00093     CVMX_IRQ_IPD_DRP = CVMX_IRQ_GMX_DRP0 + 5,
00094     CVMX_IRQ_KEY_ZERO,  /* Doesn't apply on CN52XX or CN63XX */
00095     /* 4 TIMER interrupts. */
00096     CVMX_IRQ_TIMER0,
00097     /* 2 USB interrupts. */
00098     CVMX_IRQ_USB0 = CVMX_IRQ_TIMER0 + 4,    /* Doesn't apply on CN38XX or CN58XX */
00099     CVMX_IRQ_PCM = CVMX_IRQ_USB0 + 2,   /* Doesn't apply on CN52XX or CN63XX */
00100     CVMX_IRQ_MPI,       /* Doesn't apply on CN52XX or CN63XX */
00101     CVMX_IRQ_POWIQ,     /* Added in CN56XX */
00102     CVMX_IRQ_IPDPPTHR,  /* Added in CN56XX */
00103     /* 2 MII interrupts. */
00104     CVMX_IRQ_MII0,      /* Added in CN56XX */
00105     CVMX_IRQ_BOOTDMA = CVMX_IRQ_MII0 + 2,   /* Added in CN56XX */
00106 
00107     /* 32 WDOG interrupts. */
00108     CVMX_IRQ_WDOG0,
00109     CVMX_IRQ_NAND = CVMX_IRQ_WDOG0 + 48,    /* Added in CN52XX */
00110     CVMX_IRQ_MIO,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00111     CVMX_IRQ_IOB,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00112     CVMX_IRQ_FPA,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00113     CVMX_IRQ_POW,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00114     CVMX_IRQ_L2C,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00115     CVMX_IRQ_IPD,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00116     CVMX_IRQ_PIP,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00117     CVMX_IRQ_PKO,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00118     CVMX_IRQ_ZIP,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00119     CVMX_IRQ_TIM,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00120     CVMX_IRQ_RAD,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00121     CVMX_IRQ_KEY,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00122     CVMX_IRQ_DFA,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00123     CVMX_IRQ_USBCTL,    /* Added in CN63XX */
00124     CVMX_IRQ_SLI,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00125     CVMX_IRQ_DPI,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00126     /* 5 AGX interrupts added in CN68XX. */
00127     CVMX_IRQ_AGX0,      /* Added in CN63XX */
00128 
00129     CVMX_IRQ_AGL = CVMX_IRQ_AGX0 + 5,   /* Added in CN63XX */
00130     CVMX_IRQ_PTP,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00131     CVMX_IRQ_PEM0,      /* Added in CN63XX */
00132     CVMX_IRQ_PEM1,      /* Added in CN63XX */
00133     CVMX_IRQ_SRIO0,     /* Added in CN63XX */
00134     CVMX_IRQ_SRIO1,     /* Added in CN63XX */
00135     CVMX_IRQ_LMC0,      /* Added in CN63XX */
00136     /* 4 LMC interrupts added in CN68XX. */
00137     CVMX_IRQ_DFM = CVMX_IRQ_LMC0 + 4,   /* Added in CN63XX */
00138     CVMX_IRQ_RST,       /* Added in CN63XX */
00139     CVMX_IRQ_ILK,       /* Added for CN68XX */
00140     CVMX_IRQ_SRIO2,     /* Added in CN66XX */
00141     CVMX_IRQ_DPI_DMA,   /* Added in CN61XX */
00142     /* 6 addition timers added in CN61XX */
00143     CVMX_IRQ_TIMER4,    /* Added in CN61XX */
00144     /* interrupts added in CNF71XX */
00145     CVMX_IRQ_ENDOR = CVMX_IRQ_TIMER4 + 6,
00146     CVMX_IRQ_EOI = CVMX_IRQ_ENDOR + 2,
00147     CVMX_IRQ_SRIO3,     /* Added in CN66XX */
00148     CVMX_IRQ_PEM2,      /* Added in CN70XX */
00149     CVMX_IRQ_MAX        /* One greater than the last valid number. */
00150 } cvmx_irq_t;
00151 
00152 /**
00153  * CIU MBOX_SET bits
00154  */
00155 #define CVMX_MBOX_HOTPLUG_SHUTDOWN  0x1ULL
00156 #define CVMX_MBOX_HOTPLUG_REMOVECORES   0x2ULL
00157 #define CVMX_MBOX_HOTPLUG_ADDCORES  0x4ULL
00158 #define CVMX_MBOX_OTRACE        0x8ULL
00159 
00160 /**
00161  * Function prototype for the exception handler
00162  */
00163 typedef void (*cvmx_interrupt_exception_t) (uint64_t * registers);
00164 
00165 struct cvmx_interrupt;
00166 
00167 /**
00168  * Function prototype for interrupt handlers
00169  */
00170 typedef void (*cvmx_interrupt_func_t) (struct cvmx_interrupt *self, uint64_t *registers);
00171 
00172 /**
00173  * Main structure for manipulating interrupts.
00174  */
00175 struct cvmx_interrupt {
00176     unsigned int node; /**< Set by user code. */
00177     cvmx_interrupt_func_t handler; /**< Set by user code, the handler function for the interrupt */
00178     uint64_t level_trigged:1; /**< Set by user code, Must be '1' for level triggered sources. */
00179     /* Called by user code, but set up by cvmx_interrupt_register. */
00180     void (*mask)(struct cvmx_interrupt *self); /**< Set by cvmx_interrupt_register() called by user
00181                               code to mask the interrupt */
00182     void (*unmask)(struct cvmx_interrupt *self); /**< Set by cvmx_interrupt_register() called by user
00183                             code to unmask the interrupt */
00184     void (*maskoncore)(struct cvmx_interrupt *self, int core); /**< Set by cvmx_interrupt_register() called by user
00185                               code to mask the interrupt */
00186     void (*unmaskoncore)(struct cvmx_interrupt *self, int core); /**< Set by cvmx_interrupt_register() called by user
00187                             code to unmask the interrupt */
00188     /* Fields blow only to be touched by cvmx code. i.e. they are private. */
00189     struct cvmx_interrupt *r; /**< Internal use.  Don't touch in user code. */
00190     struct cvmx_interrupt *l; /**< Internal use.  Don't touch in user code. */
00191     uint64_t data; /**< Internal use.  Don't touch in user code. */
00192     bool red; /**< Internal use.  Don't touch in user code. */
00193 };
00194 
00195 
00196 /**
00197  * Register an interrupt handler for the specified interrupt number.
00198  *
00199  * @param hw_irq_number Hardware interrupt identifier, model dependant.
00200  * @param info          Handler information.
00201  */
00202 extern CVMX_SHARED void (*cvmx_interrupt_register)(unsigned int hw_irq_number,
00203                            struct cvmx_interrupt *info);
00204 
00205 extern CVMX_SHARED unsigned int (*cvmx_interrupt_map)(cvmx_irq_t e);
00206 
00207 /**
00208  * Set the exception handler for all non interrupt sources.
00209  *
00210  * @param handler New exception handler
00211  * @return Old exception handler
00212  */
00213 cvmx_interrupt_exception_t cvmx_interrupt_set_exception(cvmx_interrupt_exception_t handler);
00214 
00215 /* Disable interrupts by clearing bit 0 of the COP0 status register,
00216 ** and return the previous contents of the status register.
00217 ** Note: this is only used to track interrupt status. */
00218 static inline uint32_t cvmx_interrupt_disable_save(void)
00219 {
00220     uint32_t flags;
00221     asm volatile ("DI   %[flags]\n":[flags] "=r"(flags));
00222     return (flags);
00223 }
00224 
00225 /* Restore the contents of the cop0 status register.  Used with
00226 ** cvmx_interrupt_disable_save to allow recursive interrupt disabling */
00227 static inline void cvmx_interrupt_restore(uint32_t flags)
00228 {
00229     /* If flags value indicates interrupts should be enabled, then enable them */
00230     if (flags & 1) {
00231         asm volatile ("EI     \n"::);
00232     }
00233 }
00234 
00235 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00236 #define cvmx_local_irq_save(x) local_irq_save(x)
00237 #define cvmx_local_irq_restore(x) local_irq_restore(x)
00238 #else
00239 #define cvmx_local_irq_save(x) ({x = cvmx_interrupt_disable_save();})
00240 #define cvmx_local_irq_restore(x) cvmx_interrupt_restore(x)
00241 #endif
00242 
00243 /**
00244  * Utility function to do interrupt safe printf
00245  */
00246 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00247 #define cvmx_safe_printf printk
00248 #elif defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_USER)
00249 #define cvmx_safe_printf printf
00250 #else
00251 extern void cvmx_safe_printf(const char *format, ...) __attribute__ ((format(printf, 1, 2)));
00252 #endif
00253 
00254 #define PRINT_ERROR(format, ...) cvmx_safe_printf("ERROR " format, ##__VA_ARGS__)

00258 }
